meanings.sent1: After a few sips of wine, she felt squiffed and giggly.
meanings.sent2: He was squiffed after celebrating his birthday with friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked squiffed after accidentally drinking from a spilled beer.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in squiffed hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The squiffed feeling of joy spread through her like a warm blanket.

meanings.sent1: The picture frame hung squiffed on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The tower leaned squiffed against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The crooked tree looked even more squiffed after the storm.
meanings.sent4: His tie was always slightly squiffed, giving him a unique style.
meanings.sent5: The squiffed angle of the roof made it stand out from the rest of the houses.

meanings.definition: in a state of disarray or confusion
meanings.sent1: Her thoughts were all squiffed after the unexpected news.
meanings.sent2: The paperwork on his desk was squiffed, making it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations ended up squiffed after the playful dog got involved.
meanings.sent4: The meeting schedule was in such a squiffed state that no one knew when to start.
meanings.sent5: The squiffed room looked like a tornado had passed through it.
